availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John F. Triplett (Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer and cattleman)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer and cattleman. Virginia native. Son of Thomas Triplett and Elizabeth Triplett. Married to Sarah Ann Wren Triplett. Father of Sarah Elizabeth Triplett Orear, Harriet S. Triplett Howard, Mary Ann Triplett Moss, William H. Triplett, John R. Triplett, Thomas F. Triplett, and Clay Triplett. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Cattleman in Montgomery County in 1865.
